Legal_Issue: Whether the CHRC erred in not dealing with the complaint under paragraph 41(1)(d) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Decision_Outcome: CHRC's decision not to deal with the complaint was upheld
Legal_Rule: CHRC may refuse to deal with a complaint if it is trivial, frivolous, vexatious, or made in bad faith
Procedural_Issue: Complaint already resolved through grievance arbitration
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged discrimination and request for additional accommodations and compensation
Outcome_on_Merits: Not pursued; matter considered resolved via arbitration
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: CHRC acted reasonably in declining to reopen
Key_Evidence_Considered: Prior grievance arbitration outcome addressing human rights allegations and remedies
